availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Moore (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Son of Frederick Moore and Amanda Moore. Resident of Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from February 8, 1862 to July 18, 1865. Captured at the Battle of Richmond, Kentucky on August 30, 1862. Paroled and sent to Camp Chase, Ohio, on September 23, 1862. Mustered out on July 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 389B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 662.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0315.
